Look in the exception that is displayed by JUnit.  It will point you to
the line in your code.  My guess, based on my experience, is that you are
you using a Servlet-related method that references data not automatically
set by StrutsTestCase.  Track down the NPE, find the line and find the way
to set it in the StrutsTestCase API.  And keep at it.  StrutsTestCase is
well worth climbing the learning curve.  I use it to TDD my actions and
forms.


--Marty


--- taviocipolla <otavio_vc@...> wrote:


---------------------------------


Hello,

I�m using StrutsTestCase and it throws NullPointerException when i 
run them.
I�m following the examples from http://strutstestcase.sourceforge.net.
When it runs the actionPerform() method it throws that exception.
My code is typed like that:


package examples;

import servletunit.struts.MockStrutsTestCase;

public class TestLoginAction extends MockStrutsTestCase {

    public TestLoginAction(String testName) {
        super(testName);
    }

    public void setUp() throws Exception {
        super.setUp();
        setInitParameter("validating","false");            
    }
    
    public void testSuccessfulLogin() {
        addRequestParameter("username","deryl");
        addRequestParameter("password","radar");
        setRequestPathInfo("/login");
        actionPerform();
    }

    
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        junit.textui.TestRunner.run(TestLoginAction.class);
    }
}


Thanks,

L.O.
